Cheers and G'day

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [Fwd: [nihontostudy] nerikawa tsuba]
messages.msgSnippet: Then please allow me to say g day mate! Although it s probably nightime there right now... It s nice to know that there are nihonto nuts all over the world!!
messages.messageBody:
Then please allow me to say "g'day mate!" Although it's probably
nightime there right now... It's nice to know that there are nihonto
nuts all over the world!! Thanks for the info on Jim!

Cheers to you too!

John

books. I do or did I should say run the Nihontomessage board.

Rich

Turner... hummm... your name is familiar to me. Perhaps we've met at
a show? Or have you authored nihonto books perhaps?

messages.subject: [Fwd: [nihontostudy] nerikawa tsuba]
messages.msgSnippet: Jim is the senior moderator here. he is way a lot at present, he will answer you but it may not be right away. Cheers Richard Turner ... Subject:
messages.messageBody:
Jim is the senior moderator here. he is way a lot at present, he will
answer you but it may not be right away.

Cheers

Richard Turner

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: [nihontostudy] nerikawa tsuba
Date: Mon, 14 Aug 2006 22:38:16 -0000
From: mr_j_price <mr_j_price@...>
Reply-To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com



Can anyone tell me how I can get a hold of Mr. Gilbert regarding
nerikawa tsuba? He seems to be the formost expert on early nihonto
koshirae and I have a few questions I'd like to talk with him about...
I've tried to e-mail him but I get a kickback. Any info at all would
be most welcome!! Thanks!




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
